comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,9 +19,10 @@ jobs:
     description: Validate formatting of code and documentation
     docker:
       - image: openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-bionic-x86_64:latest
-        auth:
-          username: $DOCKER_LOGIN
-          password: $DOCKER_PASSWORD
+# Re-enable iff docker enforces rate limitations without auth:
comment.body:
This will be happening soon though, right? https://www.docker.com/blog/docker-hub-image-retention-policy-delayed-and-subscription-updates/ says "mid 2021".

https://docs.docker.com/docker-hub/download-rate-limit/

pull_request.title: remove docker auth for now
pull_request.body:
Disables docker auth in CI.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding or removing?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,22 +9,33 @@
 # set other CPU types for other architectures; Westmere supports cpuid but not avx2
 MIN_CPUS["x86_64"] = "Westmere"
 
+def check_ubuntu():
+   try:
+      with open("/etc/os-release") as f:
+         for line in f.readlines():
+            if "Ubuntu" in line:
+               return True
+   # if file /etc/os-release doesn't exist, we're not on Linux:
comment.body: It seems like `os-release` is for Linux distributions that use `systemd` and can be (has been) adopted by other distributions. This would work to detect Ubuntu, but perhaps the comment is a bit inaccurate?
